intro: Cnicus boujarti, commonly known as the Boujart's thistle, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its spiny leaves and yellow flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions. Its flowers are composed of both ray and disk florets, typical of the daisy family. Cnicus boujarti is often found in open fields and along coastal areas where it can thrive in full sun.
